709514f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 44th Street
709514f-a.text:
Burns' Pestaurant, 783-785 Sixth Avenue, west side, between 44th
and 45th Streets, with ell running through to 45th Street.
This property was sold at auction shortly after this photograph
was made.
March 3, 1914.
MAY BE REPRODUCND.

713188f-a.title: Manhattan: 44th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713188f-a.text:
West 44th Street, north side, west from (No. 111) a point slightly
west of Sixth Ave. to Broadway, showing prominently the Belasco Theatre;
bearing No. 111-121. Adjacent to same on the west is the 13-story Hotel
Langwell (No. 123-129) which was formerly known as the Hotel Gerard.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

713188f-b.title: Manhattan: 44th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713188f-b.text:
West 44th Street, north side, west from (No. 111) a point slightly
west of Sixth Ave. to Broadway, showing prominently the Belasco Theatre;
bearing No. 111-121. Adjacent to same on the west is the 13-story Hotel
Langwell (No. 123-129) which was formerly known as the Hotel Gerard.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

709511f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 44th Street (West)
709511f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, north from W. 44th Street (where
buildings begin), viewing towards Rockefeller Center and its
dominant R. '. A. Building. At the ight is the parking lot
that utilises the former Hippodrome site(43rd to 44th St's.).
Across a corner of same appears the 2-story taxpayer and its
adjoining office structure, the Rafel Building, No. 67 W. 44th
Street. View 3 is limited to the taxpayer.
May 6, 1939
Views 1,2,3
P. 1. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTION1

709496f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 44th Street
709496f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at the S. E. corner of 44th Street (left)
showing a portien af the Hippodreme. This structure ecoupies
the full Avenue frentage from 43rd te 44th Streets and is at this
date under demelitien. The debris in the fereground is caused by
subway workers employed en the new Sixth Avenue Subway.
Sept. 20, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
Mew Yerk Public Library
MAY BE REPRODUCED
Ne; 8 S

713190f-a.title: Manhattan: 44th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713190f-a.text:
West 44th Street, north side, east of Sixth Avenue, show-
ing prominently the Hotel Algonquin (No. 59-65 W. 44th St.)
as photographed across the site of the former Hippodrome.
Adjacent to same on the right is the 8 story City Club (No.
55 W. 44th St.). At the left and right margins respectively
are the Rafel Bldg. (No. 67) and the Hotel Irocuois (No. 49).
The photographers vantage point is 43rd Street east of the
Avenue, and he is viewing northeastward.
May 5, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

713189f-a.title: Manhattan: 44th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713189f-a.text:
West 44th Street, north side, west from (No. 129), but not including
Sixth Ave. Shown in the foreground, at Nos. 139-41, is the Columbia Radio
Playhouse, formerly the Hudson Tneatre.
August 9, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709510f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 44th Street (West)
709510f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., west side, north from but not including West 44th Street,
showing the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line (right) and construction work on
the Sixth Ave. subway, which will eventually replace the elevated structure.
In the background appears the 70-story R.C.A. Building, at Rockefeller
Center, from West 49th to West 50th Streets.
August 24, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709513f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 44th Street
709513f-a.text:
(I)
Sixth Avenue,West Side from about 44th Street looking Northwards.
Hotel Ariosto is shown at the North West corner.
April 5th,I939
(2)
The same,with a closer view of Hotel Ariosto.
January 29th,I928
P.L.Sperr,Photographs,
